Description: Fragment of a marble antefix. On the front side three convex leaves with one palmetto lie on a concave surface. These are surrounded by a bridge. The detached outer contour of the palmetto is indicated by the convex backside. The edges of the leaves feature red paint. The surface of the light grey marble fragment is weathered.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (Attributed by Petrie to the 'second temple of Apollo'.)
Curator's comments: This fragment could have originated from the peak of an antefix, but also from any other detached palmetto, such as those on tomb steles. In case of an antefix, this fragment would have been put into context with a marble roof rim of a building in Naukratis, just like the palmetto piece B 405 that seems to have belonged to an acroterion. Published (Koengis 2007, 335 Cat. 30)
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B432)
Koenigs 2007 / Archaische griechische Bauteile (Cat. no.30, p.330-1, pl. 21)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.39) (Phase 3)
